docs.snippet: Britain's information commissioner is investigating whether Facebook data was "illegally acquired and used," after the social network suspended Cambridge Analytica, a firm that worked for U.S. President Donald Trump's 2016 campaign.

headline.print_headline: UK Probing Facebook After Cambridge Analytica Suspension
headline.main: UK Probing Facebook After Cambridge Analytica Suspension

docs.snippet: Several U.S. Republican lawmakers expressed concern over privacy violations on Sunday after media reports that a political consultancy that worked on President Donald Trump's campaign gained inappropriate access to 50 million Facebook users' data.

headline.print_headline: Republican Lawmakers Concerned by Facebook Data Leak
headline.main: Republican Lawmakers Concerned by Facebook Data Leak

docs.snippet: Facebook is seeking to add a new office building to its Northern California headquarters.

docs.snippet: A potential collapse of the minority Norwegian government was averted Tuesday after a senior minister resigned for writing a Facebook post claiming the opposition Labor Party was more interested in protecting the rights of terrorists than the Norw...

headline.print_headline: Norwegian Minister Resigns After Facebook Post Uproar
headline.main: Norwegian Minister Resigns After Facebook Post Uproar

docs.snippet: The Federal Trade Commission is said to be examining whether the social media giant violated a 2011 agreement.

docs.snippet: Three users of the Facebook Messenger app sued Facebook on Tuesday, saying the social network violated their privacy by collecting logs of their phone calls and text messages, in the latest legal challenge facing the company.

headline.print_headline: Three Facebook Users Sue Over Collection of Call, Text History
headline.main: Three Facebook Users Sue Over Collection of Call, Text History
